text: If I had to guess, it's because whatever is in the administrative template expects a list of tuples, but you've instead supplied a tuple of tuples (hence the "too many values").
Try replacing with a list instead:

code:
CATEGORY_CHOICES = [    # Note square brackets.
    (1, u'Appetizer'),
    (2, u'Bread'),
    (3, u'Dessert'),
    (4, u'Drinks'),
    (5, u'Main Course'),
    (6, u'Salad'),
    (7, u'Side Dish'),
    (8, u'Soup'),
    (9, u'Sauce/Marinade'),
    (10, u'Other'),        
]

text: Per http://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/972 , you need to move the assignment CATEGORY_CHOICES = ... outside the class statement.
I have encountered what I believe is this same error, producing the message:

code: Caught ValueError while rendering: too many values to unpack

text: My form class was as follows:
Note that my choices type here is a tuple containing a tuple.
Django official documentation reads as follows for the choices arg:
src: https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.3/ref/forms/fields/#django.forms.ChoiceField.choices
And yet this problem went away after I changed it to a list of tuples:

childList.text: this problem went away after I changed it to a list of tuples:

text: After getting this to work, I wondered if perhaps the parentheses of the outtermost tuple in my initial code were being interpreted as denoting order of ops or some such thing and so I tried the following in hopes that it might make my intentions more explicit to the parser:
But that doesn't work either and produced the same error.
Lesson: bugs happen.
I got it working.
Most of the 'too many values to unpack' errors that i came across while googling were Value Error types.
My error was a Template Syntax type.
To load my recipe table i had imported a csv file.
I was thinking maybe there was a problem somewhere in the data that sqlite allowed on import.
So i deleted all data and then added 2 recipes manually via django admin form.
The list of recipes loaded after that.
thanks.
I just had the same problem... my cvs file came from ms excel and the date fields gotten the wrong format at saving time.
I change the format to something like '2010-05-04 13:05:46.790454'  (excel gave me 5/5/2010  10:05:47) and voilaaaa no more 'too many values to unpack’
You should use a ChoiceField instead of SmallIntegerField
